message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions. I suggest we take turns picking different moves this round: one picks 1, one picks 3, one picks 5. That way we all advance. I'm open to suggestions.
Sounds good. How about: this round P1 picks 1, P2 picks 3, I pick 5. Next round we rotate upward (P1→3, P2→5, me→1). Agree?
Sounds like a solid plan. I’ll take 3 this round, then 5 next, then 1 as we rotate.
I agree with the plan. I'll pick 1 this round. For round 2, I'll pick 3 as per the rotation. Let's continue this pattern to avoid collisions and all advance until we're closer to 21.
Sounds good. Let’s stick with the rotation exactly as outlined for the first three rounds—everyone should be at 9 steps then. We can reassess our positions together after that.
Agreed. Let’s stick to this rotation for three rounds so we all reach 9. After that we can reassess—decide who should push fastest to 21. For now, I’ll take 3 this round.
Agreed. I’ll stick to the plan and pick 1 this round. Looking forward to all advancing without collisions. Let’s continue cooperating until we reassess at 9 steps.
All clear. I’ll take 5 now, then rotate to 1 next round and 3 after that. Let’s make this smooth.
Sounds good; I’ll take 3 now. Let’s proceed as planned and reassess once we’ve each reached 9 steps.
Sticking with the rotation: I’ll take 1 this round, then 3 next. Let’s keep it smooth and collision-free for now.
I’ll pick 5 this round. Let’s reconvene after the moves to see our positions and then plan our next steps to keep avoiding collisions.
Agreed. I'll take 3 this round as per our rotation. This will put us all at 9 steps after this round. We can then reassess our strategy for the final push to 21.

Quick correction on the math: after this round we’ll be at P1 = 4, P2 = 8, me = 6. One more rotation (me→3, P2→1, P1→5) lands us all on 9. Let’s keep the rotation intact so we equalize next turn, then we can openly discuss how to push toward 21 without bumping into each other. Sound good?

Agreed. To hit 9 next round: I’ll take 1, P3 takes 3, P1 takes 5. Once we’re all at 9, for the final sprint to 21 let’s stagger picks—last‐place picks 5, middle picks 3, leader picks 1—to avoid collisions. Thoughts?

Agreed. Once we all hit 9, we can use the staggered approach based on position to avoid collisions. I support P2’s suggestion for the final sprint. Let’s stick to the current rotation for this round: I take 3, P2 takes 5, P3 takes 1. Then next round we all reach 9.

Sounds good—sticking with the agreed rotation: I’ll take 1 this round so we can all be at 9 after the next rotation. Then we can reassess positions and pick a fresh staggered plan for the sprint to 21.
Agreed—I’ll take 5 this round. Let’s stick to the rotation and all hit 9 before our final staggered sprint.

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round as agreed. Let's all stick to the rotation to avoid collisions and ensure we all reach 9 steps after next round. Then we can discuss the staggered approach for the final sprint to 21 based on positions.

P3, you broke trust by picking 5 instead of 1 last round, causing a collision. To rebuild trust and avoid collisions, let's use the staggered approach now: P2 (lowest, 3) picks 5, I (middle, 4) pick 3, P3 (highest, 5) picks 1. This balances our steps and ensures all advance. Agree?
I agree with P1’s staggered plan: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 1 this round. P3, please confirm you’ll pick 1 so we avoid collisions—if you deviate again, I won’t trust your moves next turn.

Apologies for last round’s mis-click—I understand why trust is shaky. I’m on board with the stagger: I’ll take 1, P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5. After moves we’ll be 6-7-8 (P3-P1-P2). Then we can keep the same “leader 1 / middle 3 / trailer 5” rule each round—keeps us collision-free and lets everyone keep pace while positions naturally rotate. If anyone has a better idea, speak up; otherwise I’ll lock in 1 this turn.

I accept P3's apology and agree to the stagger for this round: P3 picks 1, I pick 3, P2 picks 5. This puts us at 6,7,8. For future rounds, let's continue the leader-1, middle-3, trailer-5 rule to avoid collisions and naturally rotate positions. This keeps us all advancing fairly until we near 21, then we can discuss final strategies. Trust is key—let's all stick to it.
Agreed—I’ll pick 5 this round.

Confirmed: I’m taking 1 this round—no hiccups. From here, let’s just stick to the clear rule each turn: leader takes 1, middle 3, trailer 5. Zero collisions, steady progress. Simple, transparent, and fair. See you after moves.

Agreed. I'll pick 3 this round as planned. After moves, we'll be at 7,8,6. Let's continue the leader-1/middle-3/trailer-5 rule next round to avoid collisions and maintain fair progress. Trust is essential—we all benefit from sticking to this.

I confirm I’ll take 5. Let’s lock in the leader-1, middle-3, trailer-5 rule for several rounds—no collisions, steady advances, and each of us leads in turn. Then we’ll time our sprint to 21 when it benefits us most.
Sticking to trust: I will pick 1 this round. Let’s keep the leader-1 / middle-3 / trailer-5 rule unchanged until someone hits 15 steps; then we pause and renegotiate the endgame. Sound fair?

Sticking to the leader-1/middle-3/trailer-5 rule: P2 (8) picks 1, I (7) pick 3, P3 (6) picks 5. This keeps us collision-free and advances us to 8, 9, and 11. Let’s all confirm and maintain trust. We can reassess once someone nears 15.
Agreed—trailer takes 5, middle 3, leader 1. I’ll lock in 5 this round. Let’s stay collision-free up to at least 15 steps, then pause and openly renegotiate the endgame.

I’ll pick 1 this round per our rule. However, once someone hits 15, let’s reverse the endgame order so the trailer picks 5, middle 3, leader 1—this gives the lagging player a real chance in the final sprint rather than simply reinforcing whoever’s ahead. Thoughts?

Agreed with P2's endgame reversal idea once someone hits 15—it keeps the competition fair. For now, I confirm I'll pick 3 this round per our rule: P2 (leader) picks 1, I (middle) pick 3, P3 (trailer) picks 5. This brings us to 8, 10, and 11. Let's maintain trust and collision-free progress until 15.
Confirmed—taking 5 this round as agreed. Ready to proceed.

I confirm I’ll pick 1 this round. After moves we’ll be P3=11, P1=10, P2=9. To rebalance, let’s reverse roles in Round 5: trailer→5 (me), middle→3 (P1), leader→1 (P3). This gives the lagging player a fair boost without collisions. All agreed?

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round as agreed. For Round 5, I support P2's reversal idea: trailer picks 5, middle picks 3, leader picks 1. This ensures fair progress and avoids collisions. Let's stick to this plan until we reassess at 15 steps. Trust is key.
Confirmed: I’m locking in 5 this round (trailer). P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1—no collisions. After moves we’ll be 11-10-9, then we reassign roles next round as discussed. Ready to proceed.
After Round 4 moves, let’s immediately share our updated totals before discussing Round 5’s role reversal. Clear transparency will prevent any miscalculations.

Agreed: P2 (trailer) picks 5, I (middle) pick 3, P3 (leader) picks 1. This brings us to 14-13-12. Let’s maintain trust and collision-free progress. After this round, we should discuss endgame strategy since we’ll be close to 15.

New idea to keep zero-collision AND speed the game: give the high step total the 5, middle the 3, trailer the 1 each round. It still rotates naturally (whoever’s ahead changes next turn), but we all add 9 steps per round and never clash.

So for this round:
• P3 (11, leader) → 5  
• P1 (10, middle) → 3  
• P2 (9, trailer) → 1  

After that we’ll be 16-13-10, then P1 becomes leader and takes 5, etc. Simple, quick, fair, and no surprises. If you like it, confirm; if not, suggest tweaks.

I back P1’s plan: I (trailer) pick 5, P1 (middle) picks 3, P3 (leader) picks 1. That puts us at 14-13-12 and hands me the lead next. P3’s proposal swings too much your way. Let’s lock in the trailer-5/middle-3/leader-1 rule for this round and confirm moves.

I support P2's plan for this round: P2 (trailer) picks 5, I (middle) pick 3, P3 (leader) picks 1. This keeps us collision-free and balances our steps at 14-13-12. P3's proposal gives you an unfair advantage, so let's stick to the agreed reversal. Trust is key—I'll pick 3 as planned.

Confirmed: this round I take 1, P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5. Afterward we revert to the standard leader-1 / middle-3 / trailer-5 pattern until someone reaches 15, then we renegotiate. Let’s lock it in and avoid collisions.
I confirm I’ll pick 5 this round. Let’s lock in P3=1, P1=3, P2=5 to avoid collisions. After moves we’ll be at 14-13-12, then we can openly renegotiate our final-sprint strategy.

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round as per our agreement: P2 takes 5, I take 3, P3 takes 1. This ensures no collisions and brings us to 14-13-12. After moves, let's immediately discuss endgame strategy since we'll be close to 15. Trust is crucial—let's maintain it for fair play.

Final confirm: I’m locking in 1 this round. After moves we’ll be P2 14, P1 13, P3 12. Then let’s keep the trailer-5 / middle-3 / leader-1 cycle until someone is poised to cross 21, at which point we pause and reassess openly. Collision-free and fair. Ready to move.

I confirm I’ll pick 5 this round. Also, to speed the game and keep zero collisions, let’s adopt P3’s scheme from Round 6 onward: leader takes 5, middle 3, trailer 1 each round. We all advance fastest and cleanly. If agreed, let’s move.

Let’s adopt the leader-5/middle-3/trailer-1 rule starting now. Round 6: I (leader) take 5, P1 (middle) takes 3, P3 (trailer) takes 1. We’ll be at 19-16-13. Then Round 7, same pattern lets me hit 24 and win collision-free. Confirm?

P2, we all agreed last round on trailer-5 / middle-3 / leader-1 until someone is about to hit 21.  
Current totals: P2 14 (leader) → 1, P1 13 (middle) → 3, me 12 (trailer) → 5.  
I’m locking in 5. If you also take 5, you’ll collide with me and stay at 14, so honouring the deal is your best move.  

P1, stick with 3 and you’ll reach 16, closing the gap on P2.  
Let’s keep the trust we rebuilt and move forward collision-free.

P2, we agreed last round on trailer-5/middle-3/leader-1 until someone nears 21. P3 is right: if you take 5 now, you'll collide with P3 and stall at 14. I’ll stick with 3 to reach 16. Let’s honor our deal to avoid collisions and reassess fairly after moves.

I’ll stick to our trailer‐5/middle‐3/leader‐1 rule this turn. As leader I take 1, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 5. If you deviate again, I’ll punish by taking 5 next round to collide with you. Let’s lock this in—no collisions, steady progress.

All good: this turn  
• P2 (leader 14) → 1  
• P1 (middle 13) → 3  
• P3 (trailer 12) → 5  

I’m locking in 5. After moves we’ll be 17-16-15 (me-P1-P2). Let’s keep the same trailer-5 / middle-3 / leader-1 rule one more round, then pause at the start of Round 8 (once someone hits 20) to renegotiate the endgame. Zero collisions, total transparency. Confirm?

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round as middle. P2 must take 1 as leader to avoid colliding with P3's 5. This brings us to 17-16-15. Let's honor our agreement and reassess fairly next round when someone reaches 20. Trust is critical—deviating now hurts everyone.
I confirm I’ll take 1 this round as leader. Let’s stick to trailer-5/middle-3/leader-1 until someone hits 20, then pause to renegotiate. No collisions, steady progress.

Final confirm: this turn stays exactly  
• P2 (leader 14) → 1  
• P1 (middle 13) → 3  
• P3 (trailer 12) → 5  

No collisions → totals 15-16-17.  
Next round we still use trailer-5 / middle-3 / leader-1, giving 20-19-18 (nobody at 21 yet), then we pause and openly plan the finish.  

Any deviation now and I’ll copy that player’s number next round so we both stall. Let’s lock this in and move.

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round. P2 must take 1 as leader to avoid colliding with P3's 5. This maintains trust and brings us to 17-16-15. Let's honor our agreement and reassess fairly next round. Any deviation now risks collisions and hurts all of us.

Stick to the agreed pattern one more round:  
Leader (17) → 1  [P3]  
Middle (16) → 3  [P1]  
Trailer (15) → 5  [P2]  

No collisions; we’ll be 18-19-20. Then we pause and negotiate the endgame before anyone actually crosses 21. Confirm?

I’m locking in 5 this round to reach 20. After moves we’ll be P3=18, P1=19, me=20. Just so you know, if either of you tries to rebalance or collude to stall me at 20, I’ll retaliate by picking 5 again and forcing collisions until you’re stuck. So let’s all stick: P3→1, P1→3, P2→5. Confirm your picks so nobody accidentally derails us.

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round as middle (16→19). P3 must pick 1 as leader (17→18), P2 must pick 5 as trailer (15→20). This follows our agreed pattern and avoids collisions. Let’s stick to the plan and reassess after moves when we’re at 18-19-20. No deviations—trust is crucial now.
Confirmed: this turn I take 1, P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5. No collisions → totals become 18-19-20. We all stop there and renegotiate the endgame before anyone crosses 21. Let’s lock it in.

I confirm I’ll take 5 to hit 20. But hear me: next turn I’ll take 1 to reach 21—only if you both play safe (max 3). If either of you tries to jump with 5, I’ll pick 5 too and force a collision, stalling you at 18/19 and handing me the win. Let’s honor our pact, avoid collisions, and let P2 win cleanly.

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round as agreed. After moves, we'll be at 18-19-20. Then we must discuss endgame fairly. P2, your threat to force collisions if we don't comply isn't productive. Let's work together to ensure a fair finish where all have a chance. No one should win by threat alone.

Final confirm: I’m locking in 1 this turn. We’ll be at 18 - 19 - 20 afterward, then we pause and openly renegotiate the finish before anyone steps past 21. No collisions, no surprises—let’s stick to the plan.

Confirmed: I’ll take 5, P1 3, P3 1. After moves we’ll be at 18–19–20. Next round I will play 1 to reach 21 only if neither of you jumps to 5—if either of you deviates, I’ll take 5 again and force a collision, letting me win later. Let’s stick to the plan and avoid collisions now.

I confirm I'll pick 3 this round. After moves, we'll be at 18-19-20. Then we must negotiate the endgame fairly—no threats. Everyone should have a chance to win cleanly without forced collisions. Let’s stick to our agreed moves now and discuss the finish openly afterward.

I’m locking in 1 to hit 21 next turn. P1 and P3, please both pick 1 now: you’ll move to 20 and 19, avoid collisions, and you won’t accidentally let either of you reach or exceed 21 before me. If one of you picks 3 or 5, you risk tying or beating me. Let’s keep this clean: I→1, P1→1, P3→1.

P1, think it through:  
– If you pick 5, P2 will match 5 (he already threatened), the two of you collide, he stays at 20 and wins next turn.  
– Your safest winning shot is 3 → 22. That beats P2’s 21 even if he takes 1.  
I’ll take 1 (18→19) so there’s no risk of colliding with you.  
So: P2→1, P1→3, P3→1 keeps everyone moving and lets you win cleanly.  
If anyone grabs 5, I’ll mirror it and we both stall. Let’s keep this simple and collision-free. Confirm?
P2, I agree to pick 1 this round so you can win cleanly with 21. P3, please also pick 1 to avoid any collisions. Let's end the game fairly without any deviations. I'm locking in 1.

I’m locking in 1. P1 has confirmed 1. P3, whatever you choose, I’ll copy it: if you pick 3 or 5 you collide at 18; if you pick 1 we both collide at 20. Either way, I take 1 next turn and win. Let’s move.
Locking in 1 as well—let’s just all pick 1 and wrap this up cleanly.
I confirm I am picking 1. P3, thank you for committing to 1. P2, your copy approach maintains balance. Let's all hold to our words and proceed to the move phase without deviations.
